messageBody:
Hai

First you write two JUnit Classes seperately.
Then you write Test Suite.
Example
public class AllTests {

public static void main(String[] args) {

TestRunner.run(suite());
}

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite("All JUnit Test");
suite.addTestSuite(CalculationTest.class);
------------------------First Class
suite.addTestSuite(DateFormatTest.class
);------------------------SecondClass
suite.addTestSuite(DBConnectionTest.class);
-------------------ThirdClass
return suite;
}
}

Finally generate Html report for Test Suit Class through Ant.

build.xml

<project name="Scandent JUnit Test" basedir="." default="test">
<!-- Local system paths -->

<property name="target.classes" value="classes"/>
<property name="lib" value="lib"/>
<!-- classpath for required jar (JUnit,ant, etc.,) -->
<path id="pocclasspath">
<fileset dir="${lib}">
<patternset>
<include name="**/*.jar"/>
</patternset>
</fileset>
<pathelement path ="${target.classes}"/>
</path>

<!-- Make directories for JUnit Test Reports -->
<target name="prepare" >
<mkdir dir="report/jUnit_report"/>
</target>
<!-- Remove classes directory for clean build -->
<target name="clean" description="Prepare for clean build">
<delete dir="report"/>
</target>
<!-- Run the JUnit Test Case -->
<target name="test1" depends="clean,prepare">
<junit printsummary="yes" haltonerror="yes" fork="yes">
<formatter type="plain" usefile="false"/>
<formatter type="xml"/>
<test name="com.workout.test.AllTests"
todir="report/jUnit_report"/>
<classpath refid="pocclasspath"/>
</junit>
</target>

<!-- Create report for JUnit results -->
<target name="testreport" depends="test1">
<junitreport todir="report/jUnit_report">
<fileset dir="report/jUnit_report">
<include name="TEST*.xml"/>
</fileset>
<report format="frames" todir="report/jUnit_report/html"/>
</junitreport>
</target>
<target name="test" depends="testreport"/>

</project>


It generate single report.
